intro: Seseli libanotis subsp. pyrenaicum, commonly known as the Pyrenean seseli, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils at elevations ranging from 1,000 to 2,500 meters. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. The subspecies is distinguished by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and compact growth habit.
